p: Flavonoids, including anthocyanins, flavones, flavonols, and flavanols, are important chemical components of Chaenomeles fruits [ 4, 13, 14]. Flavonoids have been shown to play an important role in the anti-inflammatory [ 15], anti-cancer [ 16], anti-viral and anti-bacterial [ 17, 18], anti-diabetic [ 19], and anti-oxidant [ 20] properties of many plants. Moreover, anthocyanins are responsible for many colors in plants, and therefore affect their suitability in ornamental uses.
